verses.verse: I am a rose <S%H2261><s%> of Sharon <S%H8289><s%>, A lily <S%H7799><s%> of the valleys <S%H6010><s%>.
As a lily <S%H7799><s%> among thorns <S%H2336><s%>, So is my love <S%H7474><s%> among the daughters <S%H1323><s%>.

As the apple-tree <S%H8598><s%> among the trees <S%H8598><s%> of the wood <S%H8598><s%>, So is my beloved <S%H1730><s%> among the sons <S%H1121><s%>. I sat <S%H3427><s%> down under his shadow <S%H6738><s%> with great delight <S%H2530><s%>, And his fruit <S%H6529><s%> was sweet <S%H4966><s%> to my taste <S%H2441><s%>.
He brought <S%H935><s%> me to the banqueting <S%H3196><s%> - house <S%H1004><s%>, And his banner <S%H1714><s%> over me was love <S%H160><s%>.
Stay <S%H5564><s%> ye me with raisins <S%H809><s%>, refresh <S%H7502><s%> me with apples <S%H8598><s%>; For I am sick <S%H2470><s%> from love <S%H160><s%>.
His left hand <S%H8040><s%> is under my head <S%H7218><s%>, And his right hand <S%H3225><s%> doth embrace me <S%H2263><s%>.

I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you <S%H1323><s%>, O daughters of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, By the roes <S%H6643><s%>, or <S%H176><s%> by the hinds <S%H355><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>, That ye stir not up <S%H5782><s%>, nor awake <S%H5782><s%> my love <S%H160><s%>, Until he please <S%H2654><s%>.
The voice <S%H6963><s%> of my beloved <S%H1730><s%>! behold <S%H935><s%>, he cometh, Leaping <S%H1801><s%> upon the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, Skipping <S%H7092><s%> upon the hills <S%H1389><s%>.

My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> a roe <S%H6643><s%> or a young <S%H6082><s%> hart <S%H354><s%>: Behold <S%H5975><s%>, he standeth behind <S%H310><s%> our wall <S%H3796><s%>; He looketh <S%H7688><s%> in at the windows <S%H2474><s%>; He glanceth <S%H6692><s%> through the lattice <S%H2762><s%>.
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> spake <S%H6030><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H6965><s%>, Rise up, my love <S%H7474><s%>, my fair one <S%H3303><s%>, and come away <S%H3212><s%>.
For <S%H5638><s%>, lo, the winter is past <S%H5674><s%>; The rain <S%H1653><s%> is over <S%H2498><s%> and gone <S%H1980><s%>;

The flowers <S%H5339><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%>; The time <S%H6256><s%> of the singing <S%H2158><s%> of birds is come <S%H5060><s%>, And the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the turtle-dove <S%H8449><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%> in our land <S%H776><s%>;

The fig-tree <S%H8384><s%> ripeneth <S%H2590><s%> her green figs <S%H6291><s%>, And the vines <S%H1612><s%> are in blossom <S%H5563><s%>; They give <S%H5414><s%> forth their fragrance <S%H7381><s%>. Arise <S%H6965><s%>, my love <S%H7474><s%>, my fair one <S%H3303><s%>, and come away <S%H3212><s%>.

O my dove <S%H3123><s%>, that art in the clefts <S%H2288><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%>, In the covert <S%H5643><s%> of the steep place <S%H4095><s%>, Let me see <S%H7200><s%> thy countenance <S%H4758><s%>, Let me hear <S%H8085><s%> thy voice <S%H6963><s%>; For sweet <S%H6156><s%> is thy voice <S%H6963><s%>, and thy countenance <S%H4758><s%> is comely <S%H5000><s%>.

Take <S%H270><s%> us the foxes <S%H7776><s%>, the little <S%H6996><s%> foxes <S%H7776><s%>, That spoil <S%H2254><s%> the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>; For our vineyards <S%H3754><s%> are in blossom <S%H5563><s%>.
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is mine <S%H7462><s%>, and I am his: He feedeth his flock among the lilies <S%H7799><s%>.

Until the day <S%H3117><s%> be cool <S%H6315><s%>, and the shadows <S%H6752><s%> flee away <S%H5127><s%>, Turn <S%H5437><s%>, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, and be thou like <S%H1819><s%> a roe <S%H6643><s%> or a young <S%H6082><s%> hart <S%H354><s%> Upon the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Bether <S%H1336><s%>.
